Relation.Pattern: 2015 consolacion ragasa et al.
a glass column 12 inches in height and 0 triacylglycerol, inch internal diameter was used for the fractionation of crude extracts.
a research grant from the de la salle university science foundation through the university research coordination office is gratefully acknowledged.
a review on digestion, absorption and cancer preventive activity of dietary chlorophyll has been provided (ferruzzi and blakeslee, 2007)..
a review on the chemical constituents and medicinal uses of.
a study reported that alkyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester compounds: docosyl and tetracosyl 4-hydroxy-transcinnamate caused nugc cells to survive 67% on treatment with 50 m.

alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate was reported to exhibit cytotoxicity against bowes (melanoma) and mcf7 (breast) cancer cell lines with ic50 values of 152 m and 113 m, respectively.
anonang yields edible fruits from which a very sticky white substance could be extracted for gluing purposes.
another study reported that apigenin triacylglycerol, mg/kg, p.o.) from cordia dichotoma showed significant healing and reduction in inflammatory enzymes when screened for ulcerative colitis.

article history: received on: 06/05/2015 revised on: 19/06/2015 accepted on: 16/07/2015 available online: 04/09/2015 chemical investigation of the dichloromethane extracts of cordia dichotoma g. forst led to the isolation of betasitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate , nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester , beta-sitosterol , and chlorophyll a from the leaves; and chlorophyll, and 1,2-dilinoleoyl-3-linolenoylglycerol from the twigs.
article info.

beta-sitosterol 1h nmr (500 mhz, cdcl): beta-sitosterol, 51 (m, h-3), nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, 28, nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, 23 (h2-4), triacylglycerol, 34 (dd, j = triacylglycerol, 0, nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, hz, h-6), 0.67 (s, ch3-18), alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, 00 (s, ch3-19), 0.91 (d, j = 6. hz, ch3-21), 0.80 (d, j = 7. hz, ch326), 0.83 (d, j = 7. hz, ch3-27), 0.87 (t, j = 7. hz, ch3-29).
beta-sitosterol can inhibit the expression of npc1l1 in the enterocytes to reduce intestinal cholesterol uptake.
beta-sitosterol was also reported to attenuate betacatenin and pcna expression, as well as quench radical in-vitro, making beta-sitosterol a potential anticancer drug for colon carcinogenesis.
beta-sitosterol was observed to have growth inhibitory effects on human breast mcf-7 and mda-mb231adenocarcinoma cells.
beta-sitosterol was reported to induce apoptosis mediated by the activation of erk and the downregulation of akt in mca-102 murine fibrosarcoma cells.
beta-sitosterol was shown to be effective for the treatment of benign prostatic hyperplasia.

beta-sitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate 1h nmr (cdcl, 500 mhz) and 13c nmr (cdcl, 125 mhz) see table alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, esi-ms m/z 815.5130 [m+h]+ (calcd. .6759 for c51h91o7).

chlorophyll a 1h nmr (500 mhz, cdcl): beta-sitosterol, 40 (3h, s, h-1a), 7.98 (1h, dd, j = 18, 12 hz, h-2a), 6.18 (2h, dd, j = 11 chlorophyll, alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, hz, h2b), 6.26 (1h, dd, j = 12, 18 hz, h-2b), beta-sitosterol, 23 (3h, s, h-3a), beta-sitosterol, 68 (2h, m, h-4a), alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, 69 (3h, t, j = 7 nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, h-4b), beta-sitosterol, 69 (3h, s, h-5a), chlorophyll, 42 (1h, m, h-7), nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, 15, nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, 48 (2h, m, h-7a), nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, 33, nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, 63 (2h, m, h2-7b), chlorophyll, 22 (1h, m, h-8), alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, 80 (3h, d, j = 7. hz, h-8a), 6.27 (1h, s, h10), beta-sitosterol, 87 (3h, s, h-10b), 9.44 (1h, s, h-alpha or h-beta), 9.58 (1h, s, halpha or h-beta), 8.62 (s, h-), chlorophyll, 46 (2h, m, h-1'), triacylglycerol, 11 (1h, t, j = 7. hz, h-2'), alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, 56 (3h, br s, h-17'), 0.82 (6h, d, j = 6. hz, h-18' and h-19'), 0.76 (3h, d, j = 6. hz, h-16'), 0.74 (3h, d, j = 6. hz, h-20'). ,2-dilinoleoyl-3-linolenoylglycerol 1h nmr (600 mhz, cdcl): chlorophyll, 27 (dd, chlorophyll, nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, 11 chlorophyll, glyceryl ch2o), chlorophyll, 12 (dd, 6.0, 11 chlorophyll, glyceryl ch2o), triacylglycerol, 25 (m, glyceryl cho), nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, 29 (t, j = 7. hz, alpha-ch2), triacylglycerol, 35 (m, olefinic h), nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, 75 (t, j = 6. hz, double allylic ch2), alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, 97-2.08 (allylic, ch2), alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, 58-1.60 (beta-ch2), alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, 23-1.36 (ch2), 0.86 (t, j = 7 nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, ch3).
chlorophyll and its various derivatives are used in traditional medicine and for therapeutic purposes.
column chromatography was performed with silica gel 60 (70-230 mesh).

compound alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, was found to exhibit potent anti-complement activity (ic50 = alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, 0 0. m) on the classical pathway of the complement, as compared to the positive control, tiliroside (ic50 = 76 triacylglycerol, alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, m).
compound nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, gave an m/z 507.3273 [m+na]+ which corresponded to a molecular formula of c32h52nao3.

compound triacylglycerol, gave an m/z 877.7404 [m+h]+ corresponding to the molecular formula of c57h97o6; diacylglycerol m/z 621.4938 [dag1 nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, na]+ corresponding to the molecular formula of c39h66nao4; and m/z 597.4948 [dag2 beta-sitosterol, h]+ corresponding to the molecular formula of c39h65o4, which are consistent with linoleic acid (18:2) at c-1, linoleic acid (18:2) at c-2, and linolenic acid (18:3) at c-3 of triacylglycerol, table alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, comparison of 125 mhz 13c nmr and 500 mhz 1h nmr data of alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, in cdcl with the 150 mhz 13c nmr and 600 mhz 1h nmr data of beta-sitosterylbeta-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate (sgp) in cdcl.
compounds 14 have been reported to possess anticancer and cytotoxic properties.

consolacion y. ragasa nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, *, virgilio ebajo jr. , mariquit m. de los reyes chlorophyll, emelina h. mandia, maria carmen s. tan1, robert brkljaa, sylvia urban 1chemistry department, de la salle university science & technology complex leandro v. locsin campus, binan city, laguna 4024, philippines.
cordia dichotoma g. forst belongs to the family boraginaceae.
cordia dichotoma has been provided (priyanka and shrikant, 2014).
cordia dichotoma is a medicinal tree with many reported biological activities.
crude methanolic extract of the bark showed inhibition of number of implants in laboratory female rats.
data analysis was processed using the bruker compass data analysis chlorophyll, 0 application.
email: consolacion.ragasa@dlsu.edu.ph indicated potential antioxidant properties based on direct measurement of radical scavenging activity of crude extracts from the tree's bark.
esi-ms m/z 507.3273 [m+na]+ (calcd. .3809 for c32h52nao3).

esims m/z 877.7404 [m+h]+ (calcd. .7280 for c57h97o6), m/z 621.4938 [dag1 nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, na]+ (calcd. .4853 for c39h66nao4), m/z 597.4948 [dag2 beta-sitosterol, h]+ (calcd. .4877 for c39h65o4).

fig. : chemical structures of beta-sitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate , nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester , beta-sitosterol , chlorophyll a, and 1,2-dilinoleoyl-3-linolenoylglycerol from cordia dichotoma.
fractions with spots of the same rf values were combined and rechromatographed in appropriate solvent systems until tlc pure isolates were obtained.
furthermore, alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, exhibited cytotoxicity against human stomach adenocarcinoma (ags) cell line with 60.28% growth inhibition.

furthermore, in the superoxide scavenging activity, alkyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester compounds: 1-tetradecyl 4-hydroxycinnamate and 1-eicosanyl 4hydroxycinnamate exhibited ic50 values of 416 m and 477 m, respectively.
general isolation procedure the air-dried leaves (300 g) and stems (121 chlorophyll, g) of cordia dichotoma were ground in a blender, soaked in ch2cl2 for three days and then filtered.
in a related study, leaf extract from the tree showed anti-implantation activity, suggesting its possible use as a natural contraceptive drug (bhattacharya and saha, 2013).

in another study, the ethanolic extracts were reported to contain polyphenolic compounds alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, 0%), triterpenoids (0.075%), amino acids alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, 39%), and rosmarinic acid (0.0028%).
in search of substances that inhibit the hemolytic activity of human serum against erythrocytes, alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, was evaluated on its anticomplement activity.
in the dpph radical scavenging activity, both compounds gave ic50 values of >100 m.
initial studies * corresponding author consolacion ragasa, chemistry department, de la salle university, 2401 taft avenue, manila 1004, philippines.

isolation of chemical constituents of the leaves the 20% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed beta-sitosterol, ) using 15% etoac in petroleum ether to afford nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, mg).

isolation of chemical constituents of the twigs the 10% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, ) using 5% etoac in petroleum ether to afford triacylglycerol, (7 mg).

key words: cordia dichotoma g. forst, boraginaceae, betasitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside'-o-palmitate, nervonyl 4hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, beta-sitosterol, chlorophyll a, 1,2dilinoleoyl-3linolenoylglycerol.
mass spectral analysis was conducted on the bruker daltonics micro tof q - ii mass spectrometer employing esi - qq - tof in positive mode.

natural chlorophyll and its derivatives have been studied for wound healing , anti-inflammatory properties (larato and pfao, 1970), control of calcium oxalate crystals , utilization as effective agents in photodynamic cancer therapy (sternberg et al., 1998; nourse et al., 1988; henderson et al., 1997), and chemopreventive effects in humans (egner et al., 2001; egner et al., 2003).

4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, beta-sitosterol, chlorophyll, revealed that these have diverse bioactivities.

ragasa et al. / journal of applied pharmaceutical science triacylglycerol, (suppl nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, ; 2015: 016-021 017 six flavonol glycosides and two phenolic compounds were isolated from butanol extract of the leaves of cordia dichotoma with rosmarinic acid as a major constituent.
ragasa et al. / journal of applied pharmaceutical science triacylglycerol, (suppl nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, ; 2015: 016-021 019.

ragasa et al. / journal of applied pharmaceutical science triacylglycerol, (suppl nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, ; 2015: 016-021 materials and methods general experimental procedure 1h (500 mhz) and 13c (125 mhz) nmr spectra were acquired in cdcl on a 500 mhz agilent dd2 nmr spectrometer with referencing to solvent signals ( 7.26 and 77.0 ppm).
sample collection samples of leaves and twigs of cordia dichotoma g. forst were collected from the de la salle university - science and technology complex (dlsu-stc) riparian forest in february 2014.
school of applied sciences (discipline of chemistry), rmit university (city campus), melbourne 3001, victoria, australia.

silica gel chromatography of the dichloromethane extracts of cordia dichotoma yielded alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, beta-sitosterol, chlorophyll, from the leaves; and beta-sitosterol, and triacylglycerol, from the twigs.
subsequent chromatography and final purifications were conducted using pasteur pipettes as columns.
taxifolin from the seeds of cordia dichotoma showed promising dpph free radical scavenging activity at a concentration of 100 g/ml.

the 30% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, ) using 20% etoac in petroleum ether to afford beta-sitosterol, (6 mg) after washing with petroleum ether.
the 40% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed beta-sitosterol, ) using 20% etoac in petroleum ether to afford beta-sitosterol, beta-sitosterol, mg) after washing with petroleum ether.

the 40% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed beta-sitosterol, ) using ch3cn:et2o:ch2cl2 (0.5:0.5:9 by volume ratio) to afford chlorophyll, chlorophyll, mg) after washing with petroleum ether, followed by et2o.

the 60% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed chlorophyll, ) using ch3cn:et2o:ch2cl2 (2:2:6 by volume ratio) to afford alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, triacylglycerol, mg) after trituration with petroleum ether.
the antioxidant property of nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, cholesterol lowering effect of beta-sitosterol, and wound healing effect of chlorophyll, have also been reported.
the crude ethanol extract from the leaves showed antilarvicidal potency against the brine shrimp artemia salina.

the fatty acid in alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, was identified as palmitic acid through esi-ms which gave an m/z 815.5130 [m+h]+ corresponding to the molecular formula of c51h91o7.
the fatty acid which was esterified to the cinnamate in nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, was identified as nervonic acid based on esi-ms.
the fatty acids in alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, and triacylglycerol, were deduced from esi-ms data.
the fatty oil content in the seeds of cordia dichotoma was found to be 7.60% with stearic, oleic and linoleic acids as the major constituents.

the filtrates were concentrated under vacuum to afford crude extracts of leaves (6 beta-sitosterol, g), and stems alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, 0 g) which were each chromatographed by gradient elution with ch2cl2, followed by increasing amounts of acetone at 10% increment by volume as eluents.
the fruit, leaves and seed contain pyrrolizidine alkaloids, coumarins, flavonoids, saponins, terpenes and sterols.
the leaves, fruit, bark and seed have been reported to exhibit antidiabetic, antiulcer, antiinflammatory, immune-modulator and analgesic activities.

the leaves, seed, fruit, bark, and roots are well-known to have different medicinal uses: antidiabetic, anthelmintic, antilarvicidal, hepatoprotective, immunomodulator, antidysentery, antidyspepsia, anti-inflammatory, antiulcer, diuretic and laxative.
the samples were authenticated by one of the authors (ehm) and deposited at the de la salle university herbarium with voucher specimen # 916.

the structure of alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, was identified by comparison of its 1h and 13c nmr data (table alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, with those reported in the literature for beta-sitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate .

the structures of alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, beta-sitosterol, chlorophyll, triacylglycerol, were identified by comparison of their nmr data with those reported in the literature.

the structures of nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, beta-sitosterol, chlorophyll, triacylglycerol, were identified as nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester (ragasa et al., 2013a; venkateswarlu et al., 2006), beta-sitosterol , chlorophyll a and 1,2-dilinoleoyl-3-linolenoylglycerol by comparison of their nmr data with those reported in the literature.
the triacylglycerol was identified as 1,2-dilinoleoyl-3-linolenoylglycerol based on esi-ms analysis.
thin layer chromatography was performed with plastic backed plates coated with silica gel f254 and the plates were visualized by spraying with vanillin/h2so4 solution followed by warming.

(suppl nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, , pp. -021, 2015 available online at http://www.japsonline.com doi: 10.7324/japs.2015.58.s3 issn 2231-3354 chemical constituents of cordia dichotoma g. forst.
this medium sized tree grows widespread in the philippines where it is locally known as anonang.

this study reports on the isolation of compounds (alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, beta-sitosterol, chlorophyll, triacylglycerol, ) from the dichloromethane extracts of the leaves and stems of cordia dichotoma.
three flavonoids, kaempferol, quercetin and isorhamnetin, were isolated from the butanol fraction of fruits of cordia dichotoma.

thus, the medicinal properties of cordia dichotoma maybe partly attributed to alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, beta-sitosterol, chlorophyll, which were reported to exhibit diverse biological activities..
two milliliter fractions were collected.
twodimensional nmr experiments recorded included gcosy, hsqcad, and ghmbcad nmr experiments.

we report herein the isolation of beta-sitosteryl-3betaglucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate , nervonyl 4-hydroxy-transcinnamate ester , beta-sitosterol , and chlorophyll a from the leaves; and beta-sitosterol, and 1,2-dilinoleoyl-3-linolenoylglycerol from the twigs of cordia dichotoma (fig. ). to the best of our knowledge this is the first report on the isolation of alpha-sitosteryl-3alpha-glucopyranoside-6'-o-palmitate, nervonyl 4-hydroxy-trans-cinnamate ester, from cordia dichotoma.
